definition: a tax or fee paid for some liberty or privilege (as of passing over a highway or bridge)
compensation for services rendered: such as
a charge for a long-distance telephone call
a grievous or ruinous price, cost in life or health
examples: the death toll from the hurricane

definition: to exact part of as a toll
to sound with slow measured strokes
to sound (a bell) by pulling the rope
to give signal or announcement of

examples: church bells tolled the death of the bishop

definition: to call to or from a place or occasion
examples: bells tolled the congregation to church

definition: the sound of a tolling bell
to lead or attract (domestic animals) to a desired point
